subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: David Nalbandian beat Rafael Nadal, 6-4, 6-0, to win the Paris Masters, clinching his second straight Masters title after winning in Madrid last month. Nalbandian broke Nadal in the ninth game of the first set and three times in the second. He won the match with a forehand that bounced off the net and landed inside the line. Nadal struggled with his serve in the second set, which lasted only 27 minutes. He won only 17 percent of his second-serve points and had 5 winners to Nalbandian’s 25.
